page.title: 03Farming, Hellangove Farm 3
page.content: Politics play an ever increasing part in the decisions a farmer makes. Since joining the EEC the government has introduced a milk quota because surplus milk was being produced. Local farmers believe they keep more or less to government wishes but are angry because they think French farmers do not. The farm seems a much less 'human' unit than in the past. The family atmosphere is greatly reduced, with fewer members of the faimly now left on the farm and an even greater reduction in man power. Today the farm appears to be part of a huge institution rather than single independent unit with its own way of life which was the image of the past. With a machine/electricity dominated age this is hardly a suprising development.
